body:
### Problem

On my arch , running linux 6.4,

Lpeg is not downloading so build fails , after installing luv , it is saying Lpeg download error , connection timed out from github.

### Steps to reproduce

I have checked for 3 days , trying rebuild after running `make distclean`, the result is same.

I also installed lpeg using luarock , still the same issue.

Is there anyway I can install deps manually using the deps repo ?

### Expected behavior

.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

Master

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Arch, Linux 6.4

### Terminal name/version

Wezterm

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Build from repo

comment_data.body: Check your network. (Luarocks is even less reliable than Github.)

@clason 
I am having 24 Mbits/sec,

Also I am able to stream 1440p in youtube without buffering , so I don't think it's a network issue.

I also tried , every possible fix from wiki and faq.

That's strange. I don't recognize this problem. You could try downloading lpeg and point to your local directory in `cmake.deps/depst.txt` in LPEG_URL.

But yeah, I don't understand why only lpeg would fail. Can you clone other repos on github? Can you post the exact error message you get?
...and the _exact_ build commands, and anything that would be relevant to downloading from Github.

I can clone other repos , as I cloned deps repo, also in gitconfig I used path instead of to `https` rather than `git`.
I can paste the log but it is very long , so I'm gonna paste only 1 try ( basically It's each try it logged )

same output until it stops

> ...and the _exact_ build commands, and anything that would be relevant to downloading from Github.

```
cd neovim
make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
```
What's your `curl` version? And what happens if you manually `curl` the file from your shell?

> What's your `curl` version? And what happens if you manually `curl` the file from your shell?

curl version
```
curl 8.3.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.3.0 OpenSSL/3.1.3 zlib/1.3 brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.5.5 libidn2/2.3.4 libpsl/0.21.2 (+libidn2/2.3.4) libssh2/1.11.0 nghttp2/1.56.0
Release-Date: 2023-09-13
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz NTLM NTLM_WB PSL SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd
```
curl the file manually
```
curl https://github.com/neovim/deps/raw/2bbf329c01f38bda88c76d9416207872acb2f13a/opt/lpeg-1.1.0.tar.gz
```

not output, also it not got downloaded
that's not how curl works. try `curl -flO`.
worked fine, also got downloaded without errors.
After I changed the url of lpeg to local dir, it's giving me error on libtermkey and libvterm
Could you try running `cmake -E capabilities` in your terminal and post the output here?
Well, I have absolutely no clue what the problem could be. I'll tentatively re-open the issue, but I don't know how we should solve this.
Appreciate it so much , I have to build neovim using local deps  as I have to complete my cs assignment , I'll recheck the issue asap if it's still there.
If you need to get work done, you could (should) just download the release appimage from Github.
@clason I already build it pointing FILE_URL to local dirs , running smoothly now.

title: Lpeg download error (`cmake -E capabilities` reports `"tls":true`)
